ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to subtly influence how I treat others in both personal and professional settings?

greed.question: Have I made accumulation of possessions a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: by accumulating wealth for its own sake rather than for God 's providence

greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Did I, through my words and actions, mistreat or harass others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

lust.question: Did I reduce others to their usefulness, rather than seeing them as beloved sons and daughters of God?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, assuming that they were solely due to my own efforts and abilities rather than God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the many blessings in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others using language that was vulgar or inappropriate, violating their dignity through words?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.
